[SPELLING]: "fruited" (likely intended as "brought to light" or "became known")
[PUNCTUATION]: Quotation marks around "Pharaoh" are inconsistent in usage

[STRUCTURE]: Sudden shift from tablet discovery to court administration with minimal transitional explanation
[CLARITY]: Ambiguous reference to "Pharaoh” himself" in context of diplomatic communications
[LOGIC]: Sudden mention of Tarkhundarash of Arsapi's illiteracy seems disconnected from preceding discussion

[SYNTAX]: Long, complex sentences with nested clauses disrupt readability.
[LEXICON]: Overuse of archaic/technical terms (e.g., "preciosity," "dogmas") may confuse readers.
[PUNCTUATION]: Excessive use of semicolons and em-dashes in compound sentences.

[LOGIC]: Sudden shifts between discussing religious reforms and administrative details (e.g., officials’ roles).
[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition from theological analysis to lists of names and titles without clear context.
[CLARITY]: Ambiguous references to "the doctrine" without consistent definition for non-specialist readers.
